p: Out of the eleven compounds, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 9 were identified in all Iris sp., irisolidone- d-glucoside ( 6) was found in three species, except I. sibirica. The amounts of 2, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 9 were the highest among all identified compounds in the studied Iris sp. Compounds 5, 6, 8, and 9 were previously isolated only from I. germanica rhizomes [ 61] and were found in other Iris sp. [ 14, 43, 54]. These findings supported the importance of 2, (mangiferin), 4 (tectoridin), 5 (germanaism B), 6 (irisolidone- d-glucoside), 8 (nigricin), and 9 (irigenin) as marker compounds of Iris sp.
